definition: to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself

sentences.english: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾为我的名劳苦，并不乏倦。

sentences.english: As descendants of the early settlers， they were tolerant and hardworking.
sentences.chinese: 作为早期移民的后裔，他们忍耐而勤劳。

sentences.english: But he said most people have a limit to how much cold they can take.
sentences.chinese: 但是克龙海姆说，多数人对寒冷的忍耐是有限的。

sentences.english: Draw strength from His Word and be encouraged to endure.
sentences.chinese: 你要从他的话中汲取力量，得到鼓励而能忍耐。

sentences.english: Even in the darkest ages humanity has endured.
sentences.chinese: 即使在最黑暗的年代人也能忍耐。

sentences.english: I'm tired of your crap. I'm not going to put up with it any more.
sentences.chinese: 我对你的废话烦透了，我不会再忍耐下去了。

sentences.english: Nothing astonishes a European more in the Chinese than their patience.
sentences.chinese: 没有比中国人的忍耐更令欧洲人吃惊的了。

sentences.english: You must bear with his bad temper; he has recently been ill.
sentences.chinese: 他最近生病，发脾气时你要忍耐忍耐。

sentences.english: You must bear with his bad temper; he has recently been ill.
sentences.chinese: 他最近生病，发脾气时你要忍耐忍耐。

sentences.english: There are some who are impatient, has a bad temper and just want to finish the war fast.
sentences.chinese: 有些将领性格暴躁，没有忍耐性，只是一心追求速战。

sentences.english: Our patience has been taxed to the limit.
The fungi can also increase their hosts tolerance to drought and other soil stresses.
sentences.chinese: 真菌也能提高寄主植物对干旱和其它逆境的忍耐能力。

sentences.english: This is a tough exercise especially for guys, but please bear with me.
sentences.chinese: 特别对男生来说是个困难练习，但请忍耐。

sentences.english: Any dumb cluck can remain in the darkness and die.
sentences.chinese: 任何无言的愚笨的人可以继续再黑暗死亡中忍耐。

sentences.english: In addition, patience will also bring us sess.
sentences.chinese: 另外，忍耐也会带给咱们成功。

definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
